game: Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine - Master Crafted Edition
promise_summary: [Inference] Marketed as a remaster with notable quality-of-life and graphical improvements, implying a meaningfully improved experience relative to prior releases.
delivery_gap_summary: [Fact] SEGA offered Steam purchasers a full refund regardless of playtime (time-limited) after player complaints (including about pricing/value), with a refund window ending July 10, 2025.
refund_signal: Steam-announced full refunds regardless of playtime (time-limited)
us_relevance: Sold on Steam to U.S. consumers; refund guidance includes a U.S. time reference (PST) for the deadline.

promise_summary: [Inference] Paid DLC and Digital Deluxe Edition purchases imply the DLC items will function/appear in-game as described.
delivery_gap_summary: [Fact] The publisher/developer apologized for a DLC functionality issue (items not appearing in-game), retired the affected DLC/bundle from sale, and stated affected customers are entitled to DLC refunds outside Steam’s standard 14‑day/2‑hour window.
refund_signal: Steam-announced exceptional DLC refunds (outside standard window)
DLC/bundle retired from sale due to functionality issue
us_relevance: Sold on Steam to U.S. consumers; refund instructions route through Steam’s refund portal.

promise_summary: [Inference] Early Access buyers reasonably expect ongoing development and that the product will not be put on indefinite hold without clear consumer options.
delivery_gap_summary: [Fact] Spearhead Games said development may be put on hold and they are in talks with Valve about enabling refunds past Steam’s normal 2‑hour playtime limit (while also noting Steam’s standard refund policy).
refund_signal: Developer states talks with Valve about special-case refunds past 2 hours
development put on hold / uncertainty disclosed
us_relevance: Steam Early Access title available to U.S. consumers; refund discussions relate to Steam purchasers.

promise_summary: [Inference] Purchasers of paid packages reasonably expect those paid entitlements to remain relevant/usable under the announced business model and launch plan.
delivery_gap_summary: [Fact] The ELYON team announced a switch to free‑to‑play and a launch delay, removed paid packages from Steam, and directed prior purchasers to request refunds via Steam Support using a specific subject line.
refund_signal: Official notice directs package purchasers to request refunds
us_relevance: Steam-distributed title relevant to U.S. consumers; refunds processed through Steam Support.

game: Ys VIII: Lacrimosa of DANA (PC release delay / pre-purchase refunds)
promise_summary: [Fact] The publisher announced a specific PC release date, creating a release-timing promise for pre-purchasers.
delivery_gap_summary: [Fact] The publisher pushed back the PC release date and stated that Steam pre-purchasers could request a refund (as it remained a pre-order at that time).
us_relevance: Sold via Steam to U.S. consumers; refund pathway is through Steam Support.

promise_summary: [Fact] The developer/publisher set expectations for a near-term release date ("this year") for pre-purchasers.
delivery_gap_summary: [Fact] The release was delayed and the announcement stated that pre-orders could be refunded at any time (because it was still a pre-order).
refund_signal: pre-order refundable at any time (per announcement)
us_relevance: Steam title relevant to U.S. consumers; refunds routed through Steam pre-order/refund mechanisms.

promise_summary: [Inference] Buyers reasonably expect continued availability of a paid product listed for sale, or clear remediation if distribution is halted.
delivery_gap_summary: [Fact] The developer stated their publisher asked Valve to remove the title from sale and encouraged purchasers to request refunds via Steam.
refund_signal: Delisted from sale (publisher request) + refund request encouraged
us_relevance: Steam-distributed title relevant to U.S. consumers; refund route is Steam Support.
